API Documentation

Module: models

This module contains the core functions for managing book reviews in the BookVault application.

models.addReview(bookTitle, reviewerName, review, rating)[source]

Adds a new book review to the database after validating the review’s length.

This function inserts a new review into the reviews table. It checks if the review exceeds a maximum length (1000 words), and if so, returns an error message. If the review passes validation, it inserts the review into the database.

Parameters:

  • bookTitle (str) – The title of the book being reviewed.

  • reviewerName (str) – The name of the person submitting the review.

  • review (str) – The text content of the review.

  • rating (int) – The rating given to the book (usually between 1 and 5).

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the operation, either success or failure.

Return type:

str

Raises:

  • mysql.connector.errors.InterfaceError – If the database connection fails.

  • mysql.connector.errors.ProgrammingError – If the SQL query is invalid.

models.deleteReview(reviewId)[source]

Deletes a review from the database by its ID.

This function removes a review from the reviews table based on the given review ID. It performs a DELETE operation on the database and commits the change.

Parameters:

reviewId (int) – The unique identifier of the review to delete.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the operation, either success or failure.

Return type:

str

Raises:

  • mysql.connector.errors.InterfaceError – If the database connection fails.

  • mysql.connector.errors.ProgrammingError – If the SQL query is invalid.

models.getDbConnection()[source]

Establishes a connection to the database using configuration values from the Flask app.

This function uses the Flask current_app context to fetch database connection details (such as host, user, password, and database) from the app’s config. It returns a MySQL connection object that can be used for executing queries.

Returns:

A connection to the database.

Return type:

connection (mysql.connector.connection.MySQLConnection)

Raises:

mysql.connector.errors.ProgrammingError – If the database connection fails.

models.getReviewById(reviewId)[source]

Fetches a review from the database by its ID.

This function retrieves a review from the reviews table based on the given review ID. If the review exists, it returns a dictionary containing the review’s details. Otherwise, it returns None.

Parameters:

reviewId (int) – The unique identifier of the review to fetch.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the review details (id, book_title, review, rating),

or None if the review does not exist.

Return type:

dict or None

Raises:

  • mysql.connector.errors.InterfaceError – If the database connection fails.

  • mysql.connector.errors.ProgrammingError – If the SQL query is invalid.

models.updateReview(reviewId, review)[source]

Updates an existing review in the database after validating the review’s length.

This function updates an existing review in the reviews table. It checks if the new review text exceeds a maximum length (1000 words), and if so, returns an error message. If the review passes validation, it updates the review in the database.

Parameters:

  • reviewId (int) – The unique identifier of the review to update.

  • review (str) – The updated review text.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the operation, either success or failure.

Return type:

str

Raises:

  • mysql.connector.errors.InterfaceError – If the database connection fails.

  • mysql.connector.errors.ProgrammingError – If the SQL query is invalid.
